unnormalised: Delhi folks, prepone your chai break! News just in – India will no longer have diff time zones. So, what does that mean? Well, for starters, no more confusion when calling up your bhai in Guwahati. No need to mentally calculate if it's still a decent hour to call or if you'll be waking him up at 5:30 AM.
normalised: Delhi folks, prepone your chai break! News just in – India will no longer have different time zones. So, what does that mean? Well, for starters, no more confusion when calling up your bhai in Guwahati. No need to mentally calculate if it is still a decent hour to call or if you will be waking him up at five thirty A-M.

unnormalised: The change comes into effect from 01/01/2025. The decision to stick to a single time zone was taken after a high-level committee’s report was submitted on 15/12/2024. Apparently, having multiple time zones, while geographically accurate, was causing havoc in logistical coordination and, let's be honest, countless missed deadlines.
normalised: The change comes into effect from first January two thousand and twenty five. The decision to stick to a single time zone was taken after a high-level committee's report was submitted on fifteenth December two thousand and twenty four. Apparently, having multiple time zones, while geographically accurate, was causing havoc in logistical coordination and, let us be honest, countless missed deadlines.

unnormalised: Previously, arguments were made for having a separate time zone for the North-East, often referred to as the "chicken's neck", as the sun rose and set much earlier there. It was roughly 2 hrs ahead. Now, everyone’s on the same clock, same struggles of making it to work by 9:00 AM, same late-night Bollywood movie timings at 10:00 PM!
normalised: Previously, arguments were made for having a separate time zone for the North-East, often referred to as the "chicken's neck", as the sun rose and set much earlier there. It was roughly two hours ahead. Now, everyone is on the same clock, same struggles of making it to work by nine A-M, same late-night Bollywood movie timings at ten P-M!

unnormalised: So, set your watches, folks! Or rather, let your phones auto-update. This single time zone thing is here to stay. And remember, from next year, wishing someone "Subho Prabhat" at 7 AM in Kolkata will be just as timely as wishing them in Mumbai. Cheers to less confusion and more synchronized chai breaks across India!
